ai-pli-tv-kd7:0.3_0: The chapter on the robe-making procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd7:0.4_0: The allowance for a robe-making procedure
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.2_0: At that time thirty monks from Pāvā—all wilderness-dwellers, almsfood-only eaters, rag-robe wearers, and three-robe owners—were traveling to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha. Because the entry to the rainy-season residence was approaching, they were not able to reach Sāvatthī,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.3_0: and they entered the rains residence at Sāketa while still on their way.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.4_0: They spent the rains residence discontented, thinking, “The Buddha is only 80 kilometers away, but we don’t get to see him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.5_0: When they had completed the rainy-season residence and done the invitation procedure at the end of the three months, it was raining, water was accumulating, and it was muddy. As they traveled to Sāvatthī, their robes were soaked. They became exhausted.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.6_0: When they arrived at Sāvatthī, they went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.1.6_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.1_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks, it is the newly arrived monks of the Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.3_0: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.4_0: I hope you’re united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.5_0: “We’re keeping well, Venerable Sir, we’re comfortable,”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.6_0: we had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.7_0: And they told the Buddha what had happened during the rains and while traveling to Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.8_0: We spent the rains residence under your sway,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.9_0: ‘The Buddha is staying only 40 kilometers away, but we don’t get to see him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.2.10_0: When they had completed the rainy-season residence and done the invitation procedure at the end of the three months, it was raining, water was accumulating, and it was muddy. As we traveled to Sāvatthī, we had to Sāvatthī, their robes were soaked.”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.3.1_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.3.2_0: “I allow monks who have completed the rainy-season residence to do a robe-making procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.3.3_0: Once you have participated in the robe-making procedure, five things are allowable for you:
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.3.4_0: visiting families before or after a meal invitation, staying apart from your robe for more than a day, eating in a group, keeping as much extra robe-cloth as you need, and whatever robe-cloth is given is only for those who have participated in the robe-making procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.3.5_0: Once you have participated in the robe-making procedure, these five things are allowable for you.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.3.6_0: And the robe-making procedure should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.1_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.2_0: ‘Sir, let the Saṅgha listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.3_0: The Sangha was given this cloth.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.6_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.7_0: The Sangha was given this cloth.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.8_0: The Sangha gives this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.9_0: Any monk who approves of giving this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.10_0: Any monk who doesn’t approves should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.11_0: The Sangha has given this cloth to monk so-and-so to do the robe-making procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.4.12_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.1_0: In this way the robe-making procedure hasn’t been done.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.2_0: “And, monks, how has the robe-making procedure not been done?
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.3_0: The robe-making procedure hasn’t been done merely by marking the cloth,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.7_0: merely by a tacking the cloth,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.9_0: merely by marking with a strip of cloth,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.11_0: merely by adding a border lengthwise,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.12_0: merely by adding a border crosswise,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.15_0: nor has it been done if a monk has made an indication,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.16_0: if a monk has given a hint,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.17_0: if the robe has been borrowed,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.19_0: if it is to be relinquished,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.21_0: if it’s not an outer robe
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.24_0: nor has it been done if the robe hasn’t been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.25_0: if the robe-making procedure isn’t done by an individual,
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.26_0: or if the appreciation for the procedure is expressed by someone outside the monastic boundary.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.5.27_0: In this way the robe-making procedure hasn’t been done.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.6.1_0: And how has the robe-making procedure been done?
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2_0: The robe-making procedure has been done if the cloth is brand new, if it’s nearly new, if it’s old, if it’s a rag, if it’s from a shop; it has been done if a monk hasn’t given a sign, if a monk hasn’t given a hint, if the robe hasn’t been borrowed, if it hasn’t been stored, if it’s not to be relinquished, if it has been marked, if it’s an outer robe or an upper robe or a sarong; it has been done if the robe has been made on that very day with five or more cut sections with panels, if the robe-making procedure is done by an individual, and if the appreciation for the procedure is expressed by someone inside the monastic boundary.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.6.2_1: or if the appreciation for the procedure is expressed by someone outside the monastic boundary.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.6.3_0: In this way the robe-making procedure has been done.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.7.1_0: And how does the robe-making season come to an end?
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.7.2_0: There are these eight summaries for when the robe-making season comes to an end:
ai-pli-tv-kd7:1.7.3_0: when he departs from the monastery, when the robe is finished, when he makes a decision, when the robe-cloth is lost, when he hears about the end of the robe-making season, when an expectation of more robe-cloth is thwarted, when he is outside the monastic boundary, when the robe-making season comes to an end together.”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:2.1.1_0: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure takes a finished robe and leaves the monastery, thinking, “I won’t return.”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:2.1.2_0: The ending of the robe-making season is an end.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:2.1.3_0: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure leaves the monastery with robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:2.1.4_0: When he is outside the monastic boundary, he thinks, “I’ll make the robe right here; I won’t return.”
ai-pli-tv-kd7:2.1.6_0: The ending of the robe-making season is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd7:2.1.7_0: A monk who has participated in the robe-making procedure leaves the monastery with robe-cloth.

ai-pli-tv-kd7:13.2.3_0: What is the removal of the monastery obstacle?
ai-pli-tv-kd7:13.2.4_0: A monk leaves that monastery without intending to return.
